FRBRalias.value: The Madhya Pradesh Lottery (Niyantran Tatha Kar) Adhiniyam, 1973

preamble.p: AN ACT to control and tax lotteries in the State of Madhya Pradesh.
BE IT ENACTED by the Madhya Pradesh Legislature in the twenty-fourth Year of the Republic of India as follows,-

content.p: This Act may be called the Madhya Pradesh Lottery (Niyantran Tatha Kar) Adhiniyam, 1973.
It extends to the whole of the State of Madhya Pradesh.
It shall come into force on such date as the State Government may, by notification, appoint in this behalf.

blockList.listIntroduction: In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,-

item.p: "lottery" means a scheme for distribution of prizes by lot or chance to those persons participating in the chances of a prize by purchasing tickets;
"money" includes a cheque or any other negotiable instrument, a postal order or a money order;
"promoter" in relation to a lottery includes a proprietor, manager, organiser or any person having the control or directing the conduct of a lottery;
"State" means the State of Madhya Pradesh;

"quarter" means a period of three months beginning from the 1st January to 31st March, from 1st April to 30th June, from 1st July to 30th September and from 1st October to 31st December, in each year;
"ticket" includes, in relation to any lottery or proposed lottery any document evidencing the claim of a person to participate in the chances of the lottery.

blockList.listIntroduction: For the purposes of this Act,-

item.p: references to printing shall be construed as including references to writing and other modes of representing or reproducing words in a visible form;

documents or other matters shall be deemed to be distributed if they are distributed to persons or places whether within or without the State and the expression "distribution" shall be construed/accordingly; and
the Collector may, after making such enquiry as he deems fit, determine the person who is or is to be deemed to be a promoter in relation to a lottery and his decision shall be final.

content.p: Save as provided by this Act, all lotteries except those organised by the Central Government and the State Government of Madhya Pradesh are unlawful.

blockList.listIntroduction: Subject to the provisions of this section every person who in connection with any lottery which is unlawful under the provisions of this Act, but which is promoted or proposed to be promoted either in this State or elsewhere,-

item.p: prints any tickets for use in the lottery; or
sells or distributes, or offers for sale or distribution, or has in his possession for the purpose of sale or distribution, any tickets or chances in the lottery; or
brings, or invites any person to send into the State for the purpose of sale or distribution any ticket in; the lottery; or

sends or attempts to send out of the State any money or valuable thing received in respect of the sale or distribution, or any document recording the sale or distribution, or the identity of the holder, or any ticket, or chance in the lottery; or
uses any premises, or permits any premises to be used, for purposes, connected with the promotion or conduct of the lottery; or

blockList.listIntroduction: causes or attempts to cause any person to do any of the abovementioned acts, shall, on conviction, be punishable,-

item.p: for the first offence with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees;
for the second offence with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees; and
for any subsequent offence with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months or with fine which may extend to five thousand rupees or with both.

content.p: In any proceedings instituted under subsection (1), an accused person shall not be deemed to be guilty if he proves that the lottery to which the proceedings relate was such a lottery as is not deemed to be unlawful under section 5 or section 6, as the case may be, and that at the date of the alleged offence the accused believed and had reasonable ground for believing that no breach had been committed of any of the conditions required by section 5 or section 6 to be observed in connection with the promotion, and conduct of the lottery.
A lottery promoted as an incident of an entertainment shall be deemed to be an unlawful lottery, unless the promoter thereof has obtained a licence in respect of such lottery.

blockList.listIntroduction: The following conditions shall be observed by the promoters in connection with the promotion and conduct of such lottery, namely,-
the whole proceeds of the entertainment, (including the proceeds of the lottery) after deducting,-

item.p: the expenses of the entertainment, excluding expenses incurred in connection with the lottery;
the expenses incurred in printing tickets in the lottery; and

such sum (if any) not exceeding one hundred rupees, which the promoters of the lottery think fit to appropriate on account of any expenses incurred by them in purchasing prizes in the lottery, shall be devoted to purposes other than the lottery;
none of the prizes in the lottery shall be money; prizes;

tickets or chances in the lottery shall not be sold or issued, nor shall the result of the lottery be declared, except on the premises on which the entertainment takes place and during the progress of the entertainment; and
the facilities affoded for participating in lotteries shall not be the only, or the only substantial, inducement to persons to attend the entertainment.

blockList.listIntroduction: If breach of any of the conditions specified in subsection (2) is committed, every person concerned in the promotion or conduct of the lottery shall on conviction, be punishable,-

item.p: for the first offence with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees;
for the/second offence with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees; and
for any subsequent offences with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months or with fine which may extend to five thousand rupees or with both.

content.p: Provided that in any proceedings under this section, it shall, be a defence to prove that the breach was committed without his knowledge.

Explanation: The entertainment to which this section applies are bazaars, places of work, fetes and other entertainments of a similar character, whether limited to one day or extending over two or more days.
A private lottery shall be deemed to be an unlawful lottery unless the promoter thereof has obtained a licence in respect of such lottery.

blockList.listIntroduction: The following conditions shall be observed by the promoter in connection with the promotion and conduct of a such lottery, namely,-

item.p: the whole proceeds, after deducting only expenses incurred for printing and stationery, shall be devoted to the provision of prizes for purchasers of tickets or chances, or, in the case of a lottery promoted for the members of a society, shall be devoted either to the provision of prizes as aforesaid or to purposes which are purposes of the society or, as to part, to the provision of prizes as aforesaid and, as to the remainder, to such purposes as aforesaid;

blockList.listIntroduction: there shall not be exhibited, published or distributed any written notice or advertisement of the lottery other than,-

item.p: a notice thereof exhibited on the premises of the society for whose members it is promoted or, as the case may be, on the premises on which the persons for whom it is promoted work or reside; and
such announcement or advertisement thereof as is contained in the tickets, if any;
the prize of every ticket or chance shall be the same and the price of any ticket shall be stated on the ticket;

every ticket shall bear upon the face of it the name and address of each of the promoters and a statement of the persons to whom the sale of tickets or chances by the promoters is restricted, and a statement that no prize won in the lottery shall be paid or delivered by the promoters to any person other than the person to whom the winning ticket or chance was sold by them, and no prize shall be paid or delivered except in accordance with that statement;

no ticket or chance shall be issued or allotted by the promoters except by way of sale and upon receipt of the full price thereof, and no money or valuable thing so received by a promoter shall in any circumstances be returned; and
no tickets in the lottery shall be sent through the post.

blockList.listIntroduction: If breach of any of the conditions specified in subsection (2) is committed each of the promoters of the lottery, and where the person by whom the breach is committed is not one of the promoters that person also, shall, on conviction, be punishable,-

item.p: for the first offence with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees;
for the second offence with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees; and
for any subsequent offences with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months or with fine which may extend to five thousand rupees or with both:

content.p: Provided that in any proceeding under this section, it shall be a defence for a person charged only by his being a promoter of the lottery to prove that the offence was committed without his knowledge.

blockList.listIntroduction: Explanation: For the purposes of this section,-
the expression "private lottery" means a lottery in the State which is promoted for, and in which the sale of tickets or chances by the promoters in confined to, either,-

item.p: members of one society established and conducted for purposes not connected with gaming; wagering or lotteries; or
persons all of whom work on the same premises; or

persons all of whom reside on the same premises; and which is promoted by persons each of whom is a person to whom under the foregoing provisions tickets or chances may be sold by the promoters and, in the case of a lottery promoted for the members of a society, is a person authorised in writing by the governing body of the society to promote the lottery; and

the expression "society" includes a club, institution, organisation or other association of persons by whatever name called, and each local on affiliated branch or section of a society shall be regarded as a separate and distinct society.

content.p: Every licence granted under this Act in respect of a lottery shall be granted by the Collector on payment of such fees and subject to such conditions and shall be in such form as may be prescribed.

section.heading: Power of State Government to issue orders pertaining to licences.-

blockList.listIntroduction: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act or any rules made thereunder, it shall be lawful for the State Government by general or special order to,-

item.p: prohibit the grant of licences in respect of a lottery or class of lotteries throughout the State or in any area;
direct that no licences specified in such order shall be granted without the previous approval of the State Government;
issue such other instructions in any matter pertaining to the grant or otherwise of licences under this Act as the State Government may deem proper; and
permit sale of tickets of lotteries organised by other State Governments with whom it has reciprocal arrangements.

content.p: The Collector may suspend or cancel a licence granted under this Act in respect of a lottery,-
if there is any breach of any of the conditions subject to which the licence is granted; or
if the holder of such licence contravenes any of the conditions specified in section 5 or section 6; or
if any tax payable under section 10 is not duly paid by the promoter; or
if the holder of such licence contravences any of the provisions of section 14; or
for any other reason, for which the suspension or cancellation of the licence is, in the opinion of the State Government, necessary in the public interest.

There shall be levied in respect of every lottery for which a licence has been obtained under section 5 or section 6, a tax at the rate of 25 per cent of the total sum received or due in respect of such lottery.
The tax shall be collected from the promoter of such lottery.

section.heading: Calculation and recovery of tax levied under section 10.-

content.p: The amount of tax to be levied in respect of a lottery under section 10 shall be calculated by the Collector on the total sum received or due in respect of the lottery as disclosed in the accounts maintained and statements submitted to him under section 13.

In cases where no such accounts are maintained or no such statements are submitted, or where such accounts or statements are, in the opinion of the Collector, false or incorrect the Collector shall make the calculation to the best of his judgment.
The tax leviable under section 10 shall be paid within 30 days of the date on which such lottery is drawn.

If any tax payable under section 10 is in arrear the Collector may, in lieu therefor, recover any sum not exceeding double the amount of the tax so unpaid or any smaller sum above the amount of the tax which the Collector may think it reasonable to recover.

section.heading: Licence fee and other dues to be recoverable as arrears of land revenue.-

content.p: All sums payable as fees or taxes under this Act shall be recoverable as arrears of land revenue.

section.heading: Promoters of lotteries to keep and maintain accounts, submit statements.-

content.p: Every person promoting a lottery shall keep and maintain accounts relating to such lottery and shall submit to the Collector statements in such form and within such period as may be prescribed.

section.heading: Penalty for failure to keep accounts submit statements or keeping false accounts and submitting false statements.-

content.p: If any promoter of a lottery liable under section 13 to keep and maintain accounts or to submit statements in the manner and within the period prescribed fails to keep accounts or so to submit the statements, or keeps such accounts or submits such statements as he knows to be or has reason to believe to be false he shall, on conviction, be punished with fine which may extend to Rs. 500.

section.heading: Power of Collector to require production of accounts or to inspect accounts.-

blockList.listIntroduction: The Collector may, for the purposes of this Act at all reasonable times,-

item.p: require any promoter of a lottery to produce before him accounts or other documents or to furnish any other information; or
inspect the accounts of any such promoter.

blockList.listIntroduction: It shall be lawful for a police officer in Madhya Pradesh, not below the rank of Sub-Inspector and either empowered by general order in writing or authorised in each case by special warrant issued by a Magistrate First Class in the Districts of Madhya Pradesh,-

item.p: to enter, with the assistance of such persons as may be found necessary by night or by day, and by force, if necessary, any house, room or place which he has reason to suspect is used for purposes connected with the promotion or conduct of any lottery;
to search all parts of the houses, room or place which he shall have so entered, the persons whom he shall find therein and also such persons as may be specified by name in the warrant;
to take into custody and bring before a Magistrate all such persons;
to seize all things which are reasonably suspected to have been used or intended to be used in connection with a lottery and which are found therein:

content.p: Provided that no officer shall be authorised by special warrant unless the Magistrate concerned is satisfied, upon any complaint made before him on oath and upon making such inquiry as he may think necessary that there are reasonable grounds, to suspect the said house, room or place to be used for purposes connected with the promotion or conduct of an unlawful lottery.
All searches made under section 16 shall be made in accordance with the provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (No. 5 of 1898).

section.heading: Power to arrest without warrant in certain cases.-

content.p: A Police Officer may apprehend without warrant any person found or reasonably suspected of committing an offence under clause (b) of subsection (1) of section 4, in any public street, or thoroughfare or in any place to which the public have or are permitted to have access.
Every officer not below the rank of a Sub-Inspector of Police shall have power to investigate all offences punishable under this Act.

Every such officer shall, in the conduct of such investigation, exercise the power (except the power to arrest without warrant otherwise than under section 20) conferred by the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (No. 5 of 1898), upon an officer-in-charge of a police station for the investigation of a cognizable offence.
All offences punishable under this Act shall be bailable.
No Magistrate, below the rank of a Magistrate of the Second Class, shall try an offence under this Act.

section.heading: Government may authorise certain officer to perform functions of the Collector.-

content.p: The State Government may, by general or special order, authorise any officer to perform the functions to be performed by the Collector under any of the provisions of this Act.

Where an offence under this Act has been committed by a company, every person who at the time the offence was committed, was in charge of, and was responsible to the company for the conduct of the business of the Company, as well as the Company shall be deemed to be guilty of the offence and shall be liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly:

Provided that nothing contained in this subsection shall render any such person liable to any punishment provided in this Act if he proves that the offence was committed without his knowledge or that he exercised all due diligence to prevent the commission of such offence.

Notwithstanding anything contained in subsection (1), where an offence under this Act has been committed by a Company and it is proved that the offence has been committed with the consent or connivance of or is attributable to any neglect on the part of any director, manager, secretary, or other officer, such director, manager, secretary or other officer shall also be deemed to be guilty of that offence and shall be liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

blockList.listIntroduction: Explanation: For the purposes of this section,-

item.p: "company" means a body corporate and includes a firm or other association of individuals; and
"director" in relation to a firm means a partner in the firm.

section.heading: Collector and other officers to act subject to orders of State Government.-

content.p: The Collector and all officers duly authorised under section 22 shall exercise the powers and perform the duties conferred and imposed on them by or under this Act in accordance with such orders as the State Government may, from time to time, make.
All officers acting under this Act shall be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Indian Penal Code.

section.heading: Protection of persons acting in good faith and limitation of suits and prosecutions.-

content.p: No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall be instituted against any officer of the Government for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Act or the rules made thereunder.

No suit shall be instituted against the State and no prosecution or suit shall be instituted against any officer of the Government in respect of anything done or intended to be done, under this Act, unless the suit or prosecution has been instituted within six months from the date of the act complained of.

Any person aggreved by any order passed under this Act by the Collector or any officer authorised under section 22 may appeal against such order to the Commissioner or to such officer as the State Government may appoint in this behalf.

Every order passed in appeal under this section shall, subject to the powers of revision conferred by subsection (3), be final and shall not be liable to be called in question in any court of law whether in a suit or other proceedings or by way of appeal or revision.

The State Government may, at any time, call for and examine the record of any order of, or the proceedings recorded by, any officers, or person for the purpose of satisfying itself as to the legality or propriety of such order passed by, or as to the regularity of such proceedings, of, such officer or person and may pass such order in reference thereto as it thinks fit.
The State Government may exempt totally or partially from the payment of tax under this Act any lottery the net proceeds of which are to be devoted to a charitable purpose.
The State Government may, by notification, make rules for the purposes of carrying out the provisions of this Act.

blockList.listIntroduction: In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision the State Government may make rules for the following matters,-

item.p: the form of licence and the fees on payment of which and the conditions subject to which a licence shall be granted under section 7;
the manner in which the accounts shall be kept and maintained and the form in which and the period within which the statements of accounts are to be submitted under section 13.

content.p: Any rule made under this section may provide that any person contravening any such rule shall, on conviction, be liable to fine which may extend to fifty rupees.
Rules made under this section shall be subject to the condition of previous publication.
All rules made under this Act shall be laid on the table of the Legislative Assembly.

blockList.listIntroduction: Nothing in this Act shall apply to,-

item.p: a lottery organised by the Central Government or the State Government of Madhya Pradesh;
a lottery specially authorised by the State Government.
